description.default: You are in the entry foyer of The Broken Sextant. To the south, the raucous noise of the Common Room spills through an open archway. A portly innkeeper stands behind a high counter, managing the ledger. A simple wooden door leads back to the rented rooms, and the main exit leads OUT to the South Market.

objects.all_quests_done_message: The Innkeeper nods. 'The Syndicate's Clerk tells me you've been a great help. Your debt is clear. Feel free to use the room!'
objects.description: A portly, surprisingly cheerful-looking man who seems unfazed by his dangerous clientele. He spots you and waves you over.
objects.name: an innkeeper

objects.description: A simple wooden door leading back to your rented room.
objects.name: door

description.default: You are in the main common room of The Broken Sextant. It is loud, smoky, and smells of cheap ale and roasted meat. Mercenaries and sailors of all races crowd the space, eyeing newcomers suspiciously. Various unique tables are scattered around the room, offering places to sit and converse. To the north is the Front Desk, and to the west lies the Gambling Room.

objects.name: The Brass Astrolabe
objects.description: A heavy, circular booth tucked near the hearth. In the center of the table, bolted down to prevent theft, is a large brass astrolabe. Its plates are stained with ale, but the intricate star map remains visible, perfect for plotting a course—or a revolution.

objects.name: The Rusty Compass
objects.description: A rickety table in a drafty corner. Embedded in the wood is a compass that has seen better days; the glass is fogged, and the needle spins lazily in circles, refusing to ever point North. The wood around it is carved with the initials of lost sailors.

objects.name: The Cracked Spyglass
objects.description: A high-backed booth offering significant privacy. Mounted on a swivel stand in the center is a long telescope with a spiderweb fracture across the primary lens. Looking through it distorts the taproom into a jagged, kaleidoscope nightmare.

objects.name: The Ticking Chronometer
objects.description: This table is undeniably loud. A boxy marine chronometer sits in a glass case in the center, ticking with an aggressive, rhythmic thud that cuts through the tavern noise. It's the perfect table for meetings where time is of the essence.

objects.name: The Weathered Barometer
objects.description: A rounded booth smelling of old pipe tobacco. A large banjo-shaped barometer hangs on the pillar next to the table. The needle is stuck permanently on 'Stormy,' which seems fitting given the rowdy clientele usually seated here.

objects.name: The Iron Loadstone
objects.description: A solid oak table that feels strangely heavy. A dark, jagged chunk of magnetic ore sits on a pedestal in the center. Iron tankards slide slightly across the table toward the stone if not held firmly, making for messy spills.

objects.name: The Captain's Quadrant
objects.description: The most commanding table in the room, raised slightly on a dais. A decorative quadrant is inlaid into the tabletop in brass and dark wood. Sitting here gives you a clear view of the entrance, just as a captain watches the horizon.

objects.name: The Heavy Hourglass
objects.description: A small, intimate table for two. In the center stands an hourglass nearly two feet tall, filled with black volcanic sand. The sand never seems to run out, trickling endlessly into the bottom bulb no matter how long you watch.

objects.name: The Golden Telescope
objects.description: A gaudy booth with velvet cushions that have seen better days. The centerpiece is a telescope plated in flaking gold leaf. It points accusingly at the bar, though the lens cap is rusted shut.

objects.name: The Copper Binnacle
objects.description: This booth is warm and illuminated by the soft glow of a ship's binnacle housing standing at the table's head. The compass inside floats in oil, lit by a small, enclosed flame that casts dancing shadows on the faces of those seated there.

description.default: A dimly lit room dedicated to games of chance. Dice clatter on wooden tables and cards are shuffled with practiced ease. The air is thick with tension and smoke.
You are in a simple, spartan room at The Broken Sextant. A plain bed, a small table, and a wooden chair are the only furnishings. A single door leads OUT.

hidden_objects.description: A folded piece of parchment rests on the table.
hidden_objects.name: a note

objects.description: Looking out the window, you can see the bustling, grimy south market.
objects.name: window

description: You are seated at The Brass Astrolabe. It is a heavy, circular booth tucked near the hearth. In the center, a large brass astrolabe is bolted to the wood, its plates stained with ale but its star map still visible.
name: The Brass Astrolabe

name: The Rusty Compass

name: The Ticking Chronometer
